name: calcium nitrate production | calcium nitrate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4723/documentation

The activity represents the production of calcium nitrate from limestone and nitric acid.;Calcium carbonate in limestone reacts with nitric acid given the formula:  CaCO3 + 2 HNO3 → Ca(NO3)2 + CO2 + H2O;The reaction yield is assumed to be 98.1%.;Calcium nitrate has an N-content of 17%. Non-reacting nitric acid and ammonia are considered to be recycled or re-used internally and not being liberated to the environment. This is due to the toxicity of reactants.

The activity starts when the raw materials enter the process.

Materials entering the process are included as well as energy uses, infrastructure and emissions.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2012:Manufacture of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The process described here is the generic method used for the production of calcium nitrate from limestone and nitric acid.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Limestone (CaCO3) is usually neutralized in towers of circulating 40-48% nitric acid (HNO3). Acid solutions of calcium nitrate are fed again to the tower until the residual acidity of the solution decreases to 1,5-1,9% of HNO3. Then the free nitric acid is further neutralized with ammonia. Following the application of ammonia, some amount of ammonium nitrate forms, faciliating the crystallization of Ca(NO3)2 from a melt. The filtered solution containing ca. 49% of Ca(NO3)2 and 3% of NH4NO3 is evaporated under vacuum to 75-82% of Ca(NO3)2. This production method is used by most manufacturers of calcium nitrate in the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS).
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data have been compiled using literature and flows have been calculated using stoichiometry. Data are considered valid for the geography of Europe.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data have been compiled using literature and flows have been calculated using stoichiometry. Data are considered valid for the geography of Europe.

exchanges.description: Estimation. These values were approximated with data from an large chemical plant site in Germany producing 2.05 Mt a-1 (intermediates included) of different chemicals. The values for the energy consumption per kg of product of this plant (3.2 MJ kg-1) were used as approximation for the energy consumption of the calcium nitrate production.

It is assumed that all carbon content in lime is tranformed into CO2 during the process and emmited to air.

Estimation. The infrastructure is estimated based on the module 'chemical plant, organics'. This module assumes a built area of about 4.2 ha, an average output of 50'000 t/a, and plant life of fifty years.
